Package io.kool.mongodb

Kool MongoDb for working with
MongoDb

See:
          Description

Classes Summary
ObservableDbCollection Represents an active collection which is kept to date using replication events
ReplicaEvent Represents an event in the MongoDb Replica Set
which is usually the oplog.rs collection in the local database
which is used to replicate changes to slave databases
 

Function Summary
fun dbObject(vararg values: Pair<String, Any>): DBObject
Helper method to create a DBObject using either tuple notation or using
the ‘to’ infix operator.

com.mongodb.DBCollection observable replicationStream

Package io.kool.mongodb Description

Kool MongoDb

Kool MongoDb provides

  • a number of Kotlin extension functions for working with MongoDb
  • support for Kool Streams and MongoDb Replica Sets so that you can process database change events in MongoDb using Kool Streams

Using Replica Sets

MongoDb uses Replica Sets to be able to replicate changes from a master to slaves or other masters.

To enable replicate sets run mongodb with the –replSet option specified.

mongod --replSet foo

Then in the mongo command shell type somethign like this: (depending on how many members you wish to define in your replicate set and where your master is)

config = {_id: 'foo', members: [{_id: 0, host: 'localhost:27017'}] }
rs.initiate(config);
